ForewordğŸ”—

Neovim is my favorite editor in ZSH. However, in a desktop environment I mostly write code in a Jetbrains IDE with IdeaVim plugin. Plus, some operations can be achieved in multiple ways, only one of which is preferred. Therefore, not all Vim keys are relevant to me. On top of that, itâ€™s not necessary to document basic keys like hjkl so they wonâ€™t be included, either. For the full Vim cheatsheet, refer to here.

VimğŸ”—

Page scrollğŸ”—

<C-U> / <C-D> Half-page up/down

<C-B> / <C-F> Page up/down

Insert modeğŸ”—

<Ctrl + w> delete word before the cursor during insert mode

Jump to characterğŸ”—

fc Go forward to character c

Fc Go backward to character c

EditingğŸ”—

s Delete char and insert

IndentationğŸ”—

> Indent right

< Indent left

= Autoindent

DeleteğŸ”—

db Delete to beginning of word cc change (replace) entire line

Text objectsğŸ”—

p Paragraph

w Word

s Sentence

[ ( { < A block

b A block

t A XML tag block

' ` " A quoted string

FoldsğŸ”—

zo / zO Open zc / zC Close za / zA Toggle

JumpğŸ”—

<C-O> Go back to previous location

MiscğŸ”—

. Repeat last command

]p Paste under the current indentation level

daw delete (cut) word under the cursor and the space after or before it

ReplaceğŸ”—

:%s/old/new/g replace all old with new throughout file :%s/old/new/gc replace all old with new throughout file with confirmations

JetbrainsğŸ”—

<C-Shift-N> Go to file

<Alt-F12> Open terminal

F2 Show next error

<C-Q> show documentation

<C-B> Jump to definition

<C-Shift-I> Show definition

<C-0> File structure

<Alt-1> Project files
